quotes.quote: Time management is an oxymoron. Time is beyond our control, and the clock keeps ticking regardless of how we lead our lives. Priority management is the answer to maximizing the time we have.
This is the key to time management - to see the value of every moment.
I think time management as a label encourages people to view each 24-hour period as a slot in which they should pack as much as possible.
Time management is the mantra of my life.
It's not enough to be busy; so are the ants. The question is: what are we busy about?
Time management is a big part of the director's job.
No, my entire life is planned. It's called time management.
Don't let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.
You will never find time for anything. If you want time you must make it.
Start by doing whats necessary, then whats possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today.
Be mindful of how you approach time. Watching the clock is not the same as watching the sun rise.
It's better to do the right thing slowly than the wrong thing quickly.
Once you have mastered time, you will understand how true it is that most people overestimate what they can accomplish in a year   and underestimate what they can achieve in a decade!
Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination; Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
The more business a man has to do, the more he is able to accomplish, for he learns to economize his time.
Ordinary people think merely how they will spend their time, a man of intellect tries to use it.
We can no more afford to spend major time on minor things than we can to spend minor time on major things.
I recommend to you to take care of the minutes; for hours will take care of themselves.
The day is of infinite length for him who knows how to appreciate and use it.
If you want to make good use of your time, you've got to know what's most important and then give it all you've got.
I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career.
You've got to think about big things while you're doing small things, so that all the small things go in the right direction.
The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.
The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
Don't mistake movement for achievement. It's easy to get faked out by being busy. The question is: Busy doing what?
Time = Life, Therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life.
Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.
Time management is life managemnent.
Those who prefer interacting with people over task achievement tend to be more careless about time management.
